intro: Amsinckia lunaris, commonly known as the moonflower fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Amsinckia lunaris is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
